title: Synthetic Recap
body:
PORTLAND, Ore. — On a night destined to be remembered for one man’s singular brilliance, the Charlotte Hornets rode a historic, virtuoso performance from Glen Rice to a nail-biting 91-89 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers.

Rice was simply unstoppable. The Hornets’ forward erupted for a game-high 42 points, a scoring barrage that captivated the arena and single-handedly carried his team. Every possession seemed to run through his hands, and every defensive scheme Portland threw at him proved futile. His shot-making was a thing of beauty, a relentless exhibition of offensive firepower that left the Trail Blazers scrambling for answers.

While Rice’s offensive explosion provided the foundation, the game hung in the balance until the final second. Portland’s Isaiah Rider countered with a strong 26-point effort of his own, keeping the Blazers within striking distance and setting the stage for a frantic finish. The tension peaked as Kenny Anderson, who had been quiet from the field, went to the free-throw line with a chance to tie or take the lead in the game's dying moments. The pressure proved immense, and Anderson’s crucial miss sealed the hard-fought outcome for the Hornets.

But this night belonged to one man. Glen Rice’s 42-point masterpiece was not just a high-scoring game; it was a legendary performance that will be etched in the annals of Hornets history. On a night when every point was precious, Rice provided nearly half of his team’s total, delivering a road win through sheer force of will and securing his place in the spotlight with a performance for the ages.
